snippet: A study provides sound evidence that New York City students at small, specialized high schools are more likely to graduate than students in large, traditional high schools.
abstract: Editorial welcomes study finding New York City students at small, specialized high schools are more likely to graduate than students in large, traditional high schools; contends findings offer hope for reformers trying to save children from 'dropout factories' in the poorest communities; encourages those who are protesting the city's closure of large, failing schools to consider the study's results.
lead_paragraph: A study provides sound evidence that New York City students at small, specialized high schools are more likely to graduate than students in large, traditional high schools.
